page.title: 13Westbury Court Gardens Cont.
page.content:
The long canal is the central feature with the summerhouse or long building in the distance. This has a square lantern and weathervane built on top as originally indicated by Kip. A new gardeners cottage is built behind. the upper room is now used for a display of 17th Century engravings and pictorial views of the gardens throughout the centuries.
In the centre arm of the T canal is Neptune bestriding a dolphin. All shades of water lillies bloom in both canals. The Gazebo is by the walled garden with its bowers and formal box edged beds with nearly 100 species of plants and roses grown in England before 1700. The west wall along the canal has espalier fruit trees, varieties all in cultivation before 1700. Below, in summer, the spaces
